p: Finally, about a quarter of respondents identified their lack of belief in climate change impacts on maple syrup production as limiting their adoption of adaptation measures. As increased in exposure to extreme climatic events can raise awareness and influence climate change beliefs [ 38, 93], these respondents may change their opinions in the future. In the meantime, we believe that continuing to study the effects of climate change on maple syrup production and improving the ways of transmitting new information to maple syrup producers will help prepare the maple syrup industry for the climate of the future.
